Log4J Vulnerability - Security Flaw and Solution

On December 9, 2021, a bug (CVE-2021-44228) impacting multiple versions of the Apache Log4j2 utility was disclosed publicly via the projectâ€™s GitHub repository. This vulnerability allows for unauthenticated remote code execution. The Log4j2 open source logging library is widely used in millions of applications across the globe, and attackers are already trying to leverage this vulnerability to gain access to enterprise systems across the internet.
